cmput301.f13t01.elasticsearch

Class ESClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • cmput301.f13t01.elasticsearch.ESClient

  • public class ESClient
extends java.lang.Object
    This class deals with all direct interaction with the server via ElasticSearch. Contains methods pertaining to the posting, getting and deletion of various objects related to stories.
    Author:
    Reginald Miller, Jesse Chu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ESClient()
      Creates the gson object that knows how to serialize Media.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void deleteStory(java.util.UUID id)
      Removes a Story object of the story with the given UUID from the server.
      void deleteStoryInfo(java.util.UUID id)
      Removes a StoryInfo object of the story associated with the given UUID.
      void deleteStoryResources(java.util.UUID id)
      Removes a StoryResource object of the story with the given UUID from the server.
      java.lang.String getMedia(java.lang.String identifier, java.lang.String type)
      This method gets a base64 String encoding of a requested Media object from the server.
      Story getStory(java.util.UUID id)
      This method gets a Story object from the server based on a given UUID.
      Story getStoryByIndex(java.lang.Integer index)
      This method fetches a Story object from the server at the given index, based on the ordering of the objects in the server.

      This method gets an ArrayList of a specified number of StoryInfo objects starting at a given index based on their ordering on the server.

      This method gets an ArrayList of StoryInfo objects based on a properly-constructed query String.

      This method gets the StoryResource object associated with a given UUID from the server.

      This method is used to post a Media object to the appropriate location on the server.

    • Method Detail

      • postStoryInfo

        public void postStoryInfo(StoryInfo info)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                          java.io.IOException
        This method is used to post a StoryInfo object to the appropriate location on the server. Its server ID is the UUID of the story it represents.
        Parameters:
        info - The StoryInfo object to post to the server.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        java.io.IOException

      • postStory

        public void postStory(java.util.UUID id,
             Story story)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This method is used to post a Story object to the appropriate location on the server. Its server ID is its own UUID.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the story to be posted to the server.
        story - The Story object to be posted to the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • postStoryResources

        public void postStoryResources(StoryResource storyResource)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This method is used to post a StoryResource object to the appropriate location on the server. Its server ID is the UUID of the story it represents.
        Parameters:
        storyResource - The StoryResource object to be posted to the server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • postMedia

        public void postMedia(java.lang.String identifier,
             java.lang.String type,
             java.lang.String data)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        This method is used to post a Media object to the appropriate location on the server. Its server ID is the identifier of the Media object that is being posted.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The unique identifier of the Media object, which will be its server ID.
        type - The type of the Media object, to allow it to be posted to the proper type location.
        data - The base64 String that is the encoded Media object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • getStoryInfos

        public java.util.ArrayList<StoryInfo> getStoryInfos(int from,
                                           int num)
        This method gets an ArrayList of a specified number of StoryInfo objects starting at a given index based on their ordering on the server.
        Parameters:
        from - The starting index from which the StoryInfo objects will be fetched.
        num - The number of StoryInfo objects to be fetched from the server.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of StoryInfo objects returned from the server. Returns null on failure.

      • getStoryInfosByQuery

        public java.util.ArrayList<StoryInfo> getStoryInfosByQuery(java.lang.String query,
                                                  int from,
                                                  int num)
        This method gets an ArrayList of StoryInfo objects based on a properly-constructed query String.
        Parameters:
        query - The properly-constructed JSON String to query the server.
        from - The starting index of the StoryInfo objects to fetch based on their ordering in the server.
        num - The number of StoryInfo objects to fetch.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList of StoryInfo objects, or null if the fetch fails.

      • getStory

        public Story getStory(java.util.UUID id)
        This method gets a Story object from the server based on a given UUID.
        Parameters:
        id - The UUID of the Story object to be fetched.
        Returns:
        Returns the Story object, or null if the fetch fails.

      • getStoryByIndex

        public Story getStoryByIndex(java.lang.Integer index)
        This method fetches a Story object from the server at the given index, based on the ordering of the objects in the server.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the Story object to be fetched from the server.
        Returns:
        Returns the Story object fetched from the server.

      • getMedia

        public java.lang.String getMedia(java.lang.String identifier,
                        java.lang.String type)
        This method gets a base64 String encoding of a requested Media object from the server.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The identifier of the Media object to be fetched.
        type - The type of the Media object that is being fetched.
        Returns:
        The base64 String encoding of the Media object.

      • getStoryResources

        public StoryResource getStoryResources(java.util.UUID id)
        This method gets the StoryResource object associated with a given UUID from the server.
        Parameters:
        id - The UUID of the story whose resources are being fetched from the server.
        Returns:
        The StoryResource object associated with the given UUID.

                     throws java.io.IOException
        Removes a StoryInfo object of the story associated with the given UUID.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
